meanings.definition: To dance energetically to pop music.
meanings.sent1: She was boogying at the party all night long.
meanings.sent2: They love boogying together whenever their favorite song comes on.
meanings.sent3: The cat started boogying to the sound of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The leaves were boogying in the wind, swaying back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The kids were boogying so enthusiastically that they didn't notice the time passing.

meanings.definition: The act of dancing energetically to pop music.
meanings.sent1: His boogying always brings a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent2: The dance floor was filled with people doing their best boogying moves.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's boogying in the zoo made all the visitors laugh.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were alive with the boogying of street performers.
meanings.sent5: Her boogying was so infectious that soon the whole room joined in.
